conclusion: Analyze electric field and potential at center O before and after placing charge at C.
Points A, B, and C form an equilateral triangle; equal charges +q at A and B; O is equidistant from all vertices.
Electric field at O due to A and B cancels out, resulting in net electric field of zero.
Electric potential at O due to A and B is V = 2kq/r.
Place opposite charge -q at point C.
Net electric field at O is due to C alone, E = kq/r^2.
Total potential at O after placing charge at C is V = kq/r.
Final answer: Electric field strength at O is kq/r^2; electric potential at O is kq/r.
